41ecf3e1-3a5b-4950-9748-329ef3489683.plaintext: While in geochemistry, material components and accompanying elements of rocks and minerals in concentrations below 0.1% or 1000 ppm are referred to as trace elements, analytical chemistry usually prefers a threshold value of 100 ppm or 100 µg/g (= 100 mg/kg) or 0.01%. This must be distinguished from the narrower biological term:

title: Trace element
